intro: Limeum kenyense, commonly known as the Kenyan lime, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow when ripe. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture. Limeum kenyense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
